snippet: After two consecutive nights of sky’s-the-limit bidding, Sotheby’s sale of contemporary art started out on a high, but quickly fell back to earth, with picky buyers passing up paintings and sculptures by major figures like Rothko, de Kooning and...
abstract: Sotheby’s sale of contemporary art starts out on high on two consecutive nights of bidding, but fails to reach half as much as Christie's art auctions that were held over two nights before; Sotheby's total sales rise to $364.3 million, just above its low $336.7 million estimate, for 79 works of art, 12 of which went unsold.
lead_paragraph: After two consecutive nights of sky’s-the-limit bidding, Sotheby’s sale of contemporary art started out on a high, but quickly fell back to earth, with picky buyers passing up paintings and sculptures by major figures like Rothko, de Kooning and Takashi Murakami.

headline.main: After Two Christie’s Auctions Top Expectations, Pace of Sales Slows at Sotheby’s
headline.print_headline: After Two Christie’s Auctions Top Expectations, Pace of Sales Slows at Sotheby’s
